thread.title: Bonds higher ahed of CPI data, RBA speech
thread.title_full: Bonds higher ahed of CPI data, RBA speech

title: Bonds higher ahed of CPI data, RBA speech
text:
Wed, Jul 22, 2015, 10:05 AM AEST - Australia Markets close in 5 hrs 55 mins Bonds higher ahed of CPI data, RBA speech AAP â€“ 1 hour 12 minutes ago Recommend 
The Australian bond market is firmer as dealers look ahead to local inflation data and a speech by Reserve Bank Governor Glenn Stevens. 
ANZ economists said US Treasury prices rose overnight, with Australian bond prices following suit. 
"We expect the market to continue to trade with caution and in tight ranges ahead of today's Q2 CPI (second quarter consumer price index) and Governor Stevens' speech," ANZ economists said. 
At 0830 AEST on Wednesday, the September 2015 10-year bond futures contract was trading at 97.030 (implying a yield of 2.970 per cent), up from 97.020 (2.980) on Tuesday. 
The September 2015 three-year bond futures contract was at 98.000 (2.000 per cent), up from 97.970 (2.030). 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 1.969%, unchanged from Tuesday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 3.016%, unchanged 
Sydney Futures Exchange prices: 
* September 2015 bill futures, 97.890, unchanged 
* December 2015 bill futures, 97.920, from 97.930 
(*Closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
